Basic information

Eagles are large birds of prey with massive hooked bill and long broad wings.They belong to the family of Accipitridae.They are known for their keen sight and powerful soaring flight.Eagles belong to several groups of genera,some which are closely related. There are over 60 species of eagles. Most of the species of eagle are from Eurasia and Africa, and Outside this area,we have few species found in North America,Central and South America, and in Australia.It is bynamed the king of birds.

As a result of is strength and uniqueness is often an emblem of powerful nations.There are four major groups of eagles: fish eagles, booted eagles, snake eagles and giant forest eagles.

Harpy Eagles are the most powerful eagles in the world weighing 9 kgs (19.8 lbs.) with a wingspan measuring 2 meters (6.5 feet). Their wingspan is much shorter than other large birds because they need to maneuver in densely forested habitats. The largest eagle in the world is Steller's Sea Eagle (Haliaeetus pelagicus), which weighs 5-9 kg (11-20 lb) and has a wing-span of 2.2-2.45 m (7 ft 2 in-8 ft 0.3 in). Although it breeds mainly in Russia it has also been located in Korea and Japan. The Philippine Eagle is considered the world's rarest bird of prey and the future survival of the species is in doubt,With fewer than 400 breeding pairs left in the wild.

My future yet to be,
To glide beyond restricting Earth,
Eternity to see.

My place in Nature is secure,

Types of Eagles and their classification

  • Bald eagles
  • Golden eagles
  • Crowned eagles
  • Martial eagles
  • Wedge Tailed eagles
  • Spanish Imperial eagles
  • Black eagles
  • Harpy eagles
Some Eagles classification
Names Species Genus Family Wingspan
Bald Eagles H.leucocephalus Haliaeetus Accipitridae 1.8-2.3m
Golden Eagles A.Chrysaetos Aquila Accipitridae 1.8-2.3m
Crowned Eagles S.Coronatus Coronatus Accipitridae 1.5-1.8m
Martial Eagles P.Bellicosus Polemaetus Accipitridae 1.8-2.3m
Wedge Tailed Eagles A.Audax Aquila Accipitridae 2.0-2.8m
Spanish Imperial Eagles A.Adalberti Aquila Accipitridae 1.7-2.2m
Black Eagles I.Malaiensis Ictinactus Accipitridae 1.8-2.3m
Harpy Eagles H.Harpyja Harpia Accipitridae 1.7-2.3m

Pictures of Eagles

Some unique facts about Eagles

  1. They are one of the biggest birds on the planet.
  2. An eagles eyesight is around 8 times better than the humans vision.Eagles can see up to 3 kilometres away.
  3. The process by which both the male and female cloaca touch and the sperm is transferred is called the cloacal kiss.
  4. Both male and female eagles build their nests together.
  5. Eagles can fly as high as 15,000 feet.
  6. The bald eagle has been the national emblem of the United States since 1782.
  7. Their Grip is up to 10 times Stronger than Humans.
  8. Male and female eagles make a very good parenting tandem.
    The male's job is to guarantee that there is food in their nests,while the female roosts at their nest for 35 days to keep their eggs warm.
  9. When they get weak and old, eagles stay hidden in rocks and pluck their worn-out feathers. They wait in their hiding place until new feathers grow.
  10. Eagles are monogamous, meaning a pair remains together for life.
  11. A group of eagles is called convocation.

Video about eagles

The Haast's eagle

The largest eagle that ever lived on Earth, was the Haast's eagle. This eagle lived in the South Island of New Zealand, and became extinct around 1400. The Haast's eagle is labeled the largest known eagle of all time, and it was even bigger than today's vultures.
